commandList:
List of IM commands used in the PARAM.in file
#LIMITER F UseMcLimiter 2 BetaLimiter
Set whether or not the MC limiter is used. If it is not, the super bee limiter is used. Also set the Beta parameter for the MC limiter. The default value is shown.
#TIMESIMULATION 0.0 TimeSimulation
This command specifies the simulation time.
#SAVEPLOT 2.0 DtSavePlot F DoSaveFlux F DoSaveDrifts F DoSavePSD F UseSeparatePlotFiles
DtSavePlot defines frequency of plots in seconds.
Integrated values such as species pressure, density etc are saved into CIMIiono.outs (ionospheric) and CIMIeq.outs (minimum B surface).
When DoSaveFlux is true, then save the fluxes per energy bin into the *_SPECIES.fls files.
When DoSaveDrifts is true, save the equatorial drift velocities indexed by 1st and 2nd adiabatic invariants into the *_SPECIES.vp (poloidal velocity) and *_SPECIES.vl (longitudinal velocity) files.
When DoSavePSD is true, then save the phase space density into the *_SPECIES.psd files.
Use SeparatePlotFiles defines if each time is saved in the same file or if a separate file is used for each time.
No files are saved by default.
#SAVELOG 10 DtSaveLog
When this command is set, a log file for CIMI is written out. The log file saves the change in ring current energy content for each species resulting from each operator. A new entry in the log is written out every DtSaveLog seconds of simulation time.
#TYPEBOUNDARY Ellipse TypeBoundary
Determines if the IM outer boundary is an ellipse of circle.
#MINIMUMPRESSURETOGM 1e-2 MinimumPressureToGM
Sets minimum pressure passed to GM.
#RESTART F IsRestart
Determine whether or not to continue a previous run.
#INITIALF2 F IsEmptyF2 T IsGmInitial F IsDataInitial F IsRBSPData
Set initial fluxes (F2). If IsEmptyF2 is true, set to zero (not recommended). If IsGmInitial is true, set to Maxwellian determined from MHD quantities. If IsDataInitial is true, use values from AMPTE/CCE data. If IsRBSPData, use RBSP (van Allen probe) data.
Only one option can be true.
Default values are shown.
#END
The #END command signals the end of the included file or the end of the PARAM.in file. Lines following the #END command are ignored. It is not required to use the #END command. The end of the included file or PARAM.in file is equivalent with an #END command in the last line.
